Texto: 
-hr 154, temp 99.9*
-mucus membranes dry, no saliva or tears
-supple neck, no lymphadenopathy
-negative meningeal signs
-no rashes
-abdomen with normoactive bowel sounds,  no guarding/rebound,   non-tender to palpation
-no hepatosplenomegaly

labs
-na 131
-co2 15.6
-bun 24
-glucose 59
-interpreted as hyponatremia & mild acidosis consistent with  reduced po intake
-ileocolic intussusception successfully reduced with air enema
-patient admitted
-began having abdominal pain overnight
-emesis x 4 with normal abdominal exam
-repeat air enema 17 hours after first air enema
-ileocolic intussusception
-successfully reduced
-discharged home following day with no further issues
abdominal us
-donut shaped mass at hepatic flexure - consistent with intussusception
intussusception
intussusception
small bowel tumor
constipated fecal material
15 month baby boy has abdominal pain and vomiting

-no previous medical or surgical history
-no sick contacts
-reduced activity, po intake
-seen yesterday at outside urgent care – dx w otitis- given amoxil  but not taken
-1 day crampy abdominal pain increasing in severity & frequency
-2-3 episodes emesis (non-bloody, non –bilious)
-last normal bm yesterday
-temp 99-100 at home
-aneuric 8-9 hours
-typical patient: near age 1, male
-had 2/3 triad symptoms (colicky abdominal pain, emesis)
-targetoid lesion on us
-among 20% with recurrence
     -among 37% of recurrences in same location as primary 
-successfully reduced with air enema like 91% of intussusception patients

pathogenesis
-relatively unknown
-chart review of 152 cases showed 64% of patients   
     febrile & 30% with concurrent infection
-known complication of gastrojejunal (gj) tube
-association between intussusception & rotashield  
     vaccine
-if patient >5 then look for etiology

known etiology of intussusceptio
-mesenteric adenitis
-meckel’s diverticulum
-lymphoma
-polyp
-henoch-schönlein purpura
-cystic fibrosis


references
-etiology of non-traumatic acute abdomen in pediatric emergency  
     departments.
     yang wc, chen cy, wu hp.
     world j clin cases. 2013 dec 16;1(9):276-284. review.
     pmid 24364022

-intussusception in children presenting to the emergency  
     department.
     lochhead a, jamjoom r, ratnapalan s.
     clin pediatr (phila). 2013 nov;52(11):1029-33. doi:   
     10.1177/0009922813506255.
     pmid 24137037

-recurrent intussusception in infants.
     justice fa, nguyen lt, tran sn, kirkwood cd, thi nt, carlin  
     jb, bines je.
     j paediatr child health. 2011 nov;47(11):802-5. doi:    
     10.1111/j.1440-1754.2011.02029.x. epub 2011 mar 22. 
     pmid 21435072

-role of plain abdominal radiography in the initial investigation of   
     suspected intussusception.
     robson n, beasley s.
     j paediatr child health. 2013 oct 22. doi: 10.1111/jpc.12407.
     pmid 24147612
